posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hi Regsa! To a certain extent it will depend on what you want from the build. Good or evil might be important for you, which could restrict your options. A nice straightforward one would be to take 21 levels of Bard (for an earlier Lasting Inspiration while keeping a late skills dump) and 4 of Fighter for WS. Or 4 or 5 levels of RDD for a nice boost to strength and AC. The Fighter option would mean - even with human - an xp penalty. Have you considered a half-orc Bardbarian (or Barbardian) with the RDD thrown in (you could always lose exotic weapon proficiency)?

If you want a melee-merchant - and this is only me - I might think about only taking 4 levels of Bard pre-epic, so you'd have 29 BAB by level 40, but it's only one more, and you'd need to either increase your levels of Barbarian or take the 3rd class pre-epic.

Am I right in assuming your general feats in epic levels that you haven't specified will be taken by Great Strengths? Epic Prowess is the only other one that leaps out at me.

Just a couple of things to think about before someone who knows these classes better rocks up...

Cheers

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Here is an idea, but only if things like saving throws/divine wrath matters to you.

Barbarian 15/ Bard 15/ CoT 10 makes the most out of that charisma and still can take terrifying rage & lingering song (not lasting inspiration though). The downside is that everything comes late I'm afraid so it's not that great for hard-leveling PW's.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
If you want to retain Lasting Inspiration/Terrifying Rage however then you could always do something like Bard 20/ Fighter 4/ Barbarian 16.

Otherwise, a Barbarian 17/ Fighter 6/ Bard 17 has excellent combat abilities plus TR & Bard song.

posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
4 Fighter in Epic would bring EWF, WS and EWS.

Blackguard would boost your saves a lot.

CoT 4 would get you EWF and EProwess plus a little push on your saves.

RDD4 mentioned.

Not sure Lasting Inspirition is needed, which opens up your possibilities a LOT.

Still, play around with fighter, see what mileage it gives.
Be careful w H-Orc, he has CHA penalty.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Seems like a good build overall Regsa, early terrifying rage, immediately after that ws/ews and "lasting inspiration" as the trump card, but I think we can do a couple of improvements to that as well.

a) Is improved expertise a "must" where you play? If not, then shuffle a bit your fourth bard lvl at 15 or 18 and get that "extended song version" it will make a big difference until you get your "everlasting song" at 39.
b) You are missing epic prowess and that's a no-go for me. Here is what you will do. Take from somehwere else 3 points & start your strength at 17, now you will have to take one less great strength in order to get to 26 and that feat will be your epic prowess that you're missing.
c) You might like the Elves a lot but for this build is nothing but trouble. You will get a lot of Exp penalties because of that & also the stats aren't helping your build at all. Your best choice is human and although it might sounds plain, it is the best choice by far. By starting with Human: Str17(26) Dex8 Con14 Int13 Wis8 Cha14(16) you will have the same skill points, one more feat, 80 more hit points & 20% less Exp penalty for your build.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Valerfor has said it all, but I also wonder - is there a particular reason you want exotic weapon, or just your preference? Ain't no bad thing either way, but you could free up another feat without it.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
A much better build Regsa, you keep improving with its iteration of your build, it only needs a slight tweaking now & we are there.

a) Between Improved Expertise & Improved Knockdown I would keep IKD definitely. It is invaluable against mages & rogues alike.
b) Extra music is nice to have but not worth it if there are better stuff to take so I might swap that for either exotic, toughness or Imp. expertise, whatever you like the most.
c) Finally, here is another stat-line that will get you both more skills & more feats.

Human: Str16(26) Dex8 Con12 Int14 Wis8 Cha16, and now you will have more skills so you can max your spell-craft for a "juicy" plus 9 to all your saves vs spells & you don't need any great strengths to reach 26/16 so you can take esf in either taunt or intimidate as you like.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: You can also start with Barbarian for a net gain of 8 skill-points if you like.
